DataElement.preferredName: Magnesium Laboratory Test Result Microgram Per Gram Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The value that represents Magnesium Lab test results using the metric measure of microgram per gram (ug/g)

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for magnesium.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: An alkaline earth metal, Magnesium is important for many biochemical functions and reactions; for bone and muscle function, protein and fatty acid formation, activation of B vitamins, blood clotting, insulin secretion, and ATP formation. More than 300 enzymes require magnesium for catalytic action. The adult daily requirement is about 300 mg/day. Magnesium is found in many green plants, vegetables, and seeds; chlorophyll is a magnesium-centered porphyrin compound. Magnesium salts are used for magnesium deficiency supplementation. (NCI04):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: An alkaline earth metal, Magnesium is important for many biochemical functions and reactions; for bone and muscle function, protein and fatty acid formation, activation of B vitamins, blood clotting, insulin secretion, and ATP formation. More than 300 enzymes require magnesium for catalytic action. The adult daily requirement is about 300 mg/day. Magnesium is found in many green plants, vegetables, and seeds; chlorophyll is a magnesium-centered porphyrin compound. Magnesium salts are used for magnesium deficiency supplementation. (NCI04)

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Test Result Microgram Per Gram Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A laboratory result using the metric measure of microgram per gram (ug/g)._A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one one thousandth of a milligram._For each, generally denoting a ratio._A metric unit of mass equal to one one thousandth of a kilogram.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Test Result Microgram Per Gram Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test.:A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one one thousandth of a milligram.:For each, generally denoting a ratio.:A metric unit of mass equal to one one thousandth of a kilogram.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The outcome of a laboratory test.
A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.
For each, generally denoting a ratio.
The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
